Moreover, for much-awaited dash of thrill and adventure to fire up your cylinders, the Wild Wadi Waterpark beckons you, capture some wild Wadi water park photos,, and get ready with some of the tallest and fastest rides in the world. The Wild Wadi Waterpark welcomes you to a fun-filled day out, indeed a much needed break from your hectic rush that life is. So, learn more about the Wild Wadi Water Park ticket prices with us.

What To Expect With Wild Wadi Water Park

What certainly makes Wild Wadi Water Park undoubtedly fascinating is the theme that has inspired the place. Moreover, this water park in Dubai is modeled on the adventures Juha and his seafarer friend, Sinbad would embark on. The attention given to every detail and the emphasis put on the development and structuring of each character has won Wild Wadi many an accolade. Additionally, it has bagged the prestigious World Waterpark Association Industry Innovation Awards for Outstanding Accomplishment Design and Theming.

They say that there’s a child hidden in each one of us. True it is, and you’ll find the child inside you come alive at the Wild Wadi Waterpark, what with the enchanting place welcoming you with its 30 truly amazing rides. Wild Wadi water park Rides like the Master Blaster, the Ring Rides which let you choose between single or double rings, or the Jumeirah Sceirah, a free-fall waterslide rising to a height of 33 meters make your day very special indeed. Add to that some garnishing in the form of the Wipeout, the Riptide, and the Breakers Bay- the largest wave maker in the Middle East and your holiday is absolutely unforgettable!

What Makes The Wild Wadi Waterpark A Must Visit Place

  • It’s a very popular tourist hotspot visited by many
  • It offers exquisite views of the iconic Burj Al Arab, Jumeirah
  • The park is modelled on the enchanting theme of Juha, an Arabian folklore
  • It offers as many as 30 rides, there’s something for everyone here
  • The place is dotted with iconic rides like the Jumeirah Sceirah, Master Blasters, Wipeout, and Riptide Flow Rider
  • The dhow at the park and the story of Juha’s incredible journey are sure to have your kids bubbling with fun

Some Important Information about Wild Wadi Tickets

  • No pickups from the airport. Pick-ups are only available from the hotel/residence in Dubai
  • An additional charge applies if the pickup is from any place other than the hotel/residence, you can also take desertdaytravels transportation services.
  • The park is open from 10:00 AM to 5:00 PM. It remains closed on Mondays
  • The Jumeirah Scierah’s queue closes 45 minutes before the park gates if there’s a lot of crowd
  • In case the park is full on Eid holidays, guests are requested to come back the next day
  • Any breakage or damage has to be paid for
  • Towels are available at an extra charge of AED 40
  • No food or beverage is allowed from outside
  • No participant can carry any sharp objects, lighters, alcohol, knives, or heavy luggage

How Should You Reach There?

  • By metro: Take the metro at Terminal 3 in the airport and get off at Sharaf DG. From there take a taxi
  • By Bus: Board the metro and get off at Jafiliya Seaside. From there, take a bus to the park
  • By Taxi: A bit expensive, but you can take a taxi to the park from any place in the city

Some of the Major Attractions

  • Juha’s Journey: Glide along a ride of 360 meters as you meander through a river on single or double seating tubes- a very relaxing experience indeed.
  • Breaker’s Bay: Bob up and down at the largest wave pool in the world for an amazing evening
  • Jumeirah Sceirah: A 120-metre-long slide where you come rushing down at 80 km per hour, it’s a stunning rush of adrenaline

Burj Surj: Twist and turn through this spiralling ride and slide into a large splash pool

What’s the Best Time to Go There?

The Wild Wadi Water Park is an outdoor activity. Therefore, how the weather is matters. The weather in Dubai is at its best between December and February. However, with the Dubai Duty-Free Shopping Festival at this time of the year and the schools going on vacation, the city’s pretty crowded. If you can somehow bear the crowd, Wild Wadi Waterpark is just the perfect place to be between December and February. So don't wait and book Wild Wadi Tickets today.

In short, it’s unbridled joy at the Wild Wadi Waterpark where splashing around at the wave pool is amazing fun. The thrilling rides make your day truly memorable. What sets the Wild Wadi Waterpark apart from other locations is its intriguing Juha theme. You get to take a peek into Arabian folklore while sliding through some of the world’s tallest and fastest rides. It’s truly an unforgettable holiday experience, one that you’ll forever cherish. Also, don't forget to visit nearby places like Burj Khalifa, Lost Chambers Aquarium, and many more.

FAQs

Q. When does the waterpark open?

The Wild Wadi Waterpark opens every day around 10 am and closes by 6 pm. You can visit on weekdays and weekends. The best part is you can plan a visit any time throughout the year and spend a fun time here with your friends or family. Besides, the park has 30 different rides and attractions. Hence, arrive by 9.30 am, as there are a few formalities before entering, like baggage check, etc.

Q. Can visitors bring outside food inside Wild Wadi?

Outside food is a strict no inside the waterpark. Besides, no one must bring glassware, alcohol, or other soft drinks. However, anyone coming with an infant or toddler can bring food. Guests have to go through security bag checking at the entrance. Hence, one must be careful.

Q. Where can we look at Wild Wadi water park photos?

You can look at Wild Wadi Water Park photos online. You can find all these exciting water park rides and slides with happy faces in Wild Wadi Water Park photos.

Q. Where can we find Wild Wadi Water Park tickets?

You can find the Wild Wadi Water Park tickets from desertdaytravels. Also, you can rent a car from desertdaytravels to reach destination on time.

Q. What are the Wild Wadi Water Park ticket prices?

The Wild Wadi Water Park ticket prices start from 295 AED.

Q. What are the must-try rides on Wild Wadi Waterpark tickets?

Try Jumeirah Sceirah, Burj, Master Blasters, Tantrum Alley, Juha’s Dhow and Lagoon, Flood River, Wipeout, Riptide, etc.

Q. What to wear when coming for the activity?

Swimwear is compulsory when coming for the activity. However, you must wear full-body swimsuits to maintain the decorum of the park.
